rename.from: Albert xLarge pretraining on single v3-8 tpu
rename.to: Albert xLarge pretraining idles on single v3-8 tpu

body: @dhruvsakalley @josecannete Google Cloud has had a bug internally for about a month.  They just pushed a fix.  I had to delete and re-recreate my TPUs, but now I see uninterrupted training.  It's unclear if your issue is due to the same bug, but you might try re-creating your TPUs.  (Don't just stop-start them, you have to delete them apparently).  https://github.com/tensorflow/tpu/issues/609#issuecomment-558819717
Hi all. I am facing the same issue, tried deleting and re-creating the TPUs but it didn't solve the problem. @dhruvsakalley @josecannete would you mind telling me how you solved the problem?

issue.title: Explain the variables in the checkpoint

repository.name: bert
repository.description: TensorFlow code and pre-trained models for BERT

issue.body:
When you look at the variables in the pretrained base uncased BERT the varibles look like list 1. When you do the training from scratch, 2 additional variables per layer are introduced, with suffixes adam_m and adam_v. It would be nice for someone to explain what these variables are? and what is their significance to the process of training?
If one were to manually initialize variables from a prior checkpoint what would be the translation into these variables?

body: After the bugfix on the TPU VM I didn't encounter the issue again.
Same for me. The problem was not in our part.

issue.title: TPU training problem

repository.name: albert
repository.description: ALBERT: A Lite BERT for Self-supervised Learning of Language Representations

issue.body:
Hi all, thanks for the cool contribution.

I am training ALBERT base on a 115GB dataset (split in 4124 shards, 1.6TB in tfrecord files) on a v3-8 cloud TPU. 

I'm using the following parameters:
--num_train_steps 2000000
--num_warmup_steps 12500
--save_checkpoints_steps 50000 
--keep_checkpoint_max 1000
--iterations_per_loop 4000
--learning_rate 0.00022 
--max_seq_length 512
--max_predictions_per_seq 77 


### Problem 1:
When launching training, I get the following warning repeatedly:


INFO:tensorflow:Init TPU system

Regarding **Problem 1**, I found [this issue](https://github.com/google-research/google-research/issues/146) presenting the same problem. I deleted the TPU instances and recreated them but still got the same problem though this seems to have solved the problem for other users. 

Anybody faced the same issue and managed to solve it? Thanks a lot in advance for the help :)
